channel.title: My first server, be patient
channel.description:
Okay well I've followed a number of guides and... Well... I've gotten to the point of no return. xD Its impossible for me to give up the idea of this not working :( (guess its a determination thing)
But anyways. I've gotten a server client and source and most guides have been a bit shady on detail. Which I'm not sure if I should ignore the missing details or be concerned.
But anyways, on to my help topic o.o
I've been able to load up the client, and I have no-ip and a no-ip domain/server/host or w/e you wanna call it. I've port forwarded 43594 and I've entered the IP as the No-IP host that I made previously.
But for some reason in the command prompt I tend to get this error so far no matter what I do:
"error_game_js5connect" I'm using Mezzy-scape v3.5 client AND source.
This is one of the details most guides lack to tell about. Do I merge the folders? If so, where do I place the content in the other folder?
Also the actual client won't load up 100% It simply stays at 'connection to update server'
-sigh- I'm not sure but, help would be more than appreciated. I'll update this topic as I learn a bit more and hopefully can receive a bit of help. :D
Edit #1: Right well I just now tried to compile the client and received this error o.o: [code]Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

Are you damaged?
[/quote]

Considering his signature contains the word “proudfulll”, I’d assume so.[/quote]
Agreed…
-sigh-

I’m going to sleep Dx

item.title: My first server, be patient
item.dc:creator: @Rosiered Rosiered
item.description:
@Rosiered wrote:

@echo off
color 0b
@echo NineScape 508 Client!
@echo off
cd files
java client 66 live live software members english game0
pause[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 06, 2009, 01:18:15 am[/size][hr]Well honestly, I feel like so much of a fool…

When I set the path, and classpath.

I was so caught up in reading the tutorial. That I DID do the step, but immediatly continued to the next
step… Not pressing OK to confirm the settings… >.>

-feels dumb-

Thanks so much for your help!

Thanks,
~Rosie

Read full topic

item.title: My first server, be patient
item.dc:creator: @nadnerb_doow nadnerb_doow
item.description:
@nadnerb_doow wrote:

Localhost should suffice, as long as the client is being allocated enough memory. See above.

Read full topic

item.title: My first server, be patient
item.dc:creator: @Rosiered Rosiered
item.description:
@Rosiered wrote:

Read the above info xD

I still actually get frozen at the updating screen. o.o

Are there any Ip’s that should be changed anywhere?

Read full topic

item.title: My first server, be patient
item.dc:creator: @nadnerb_doow nadnerb_doow
item.description:
@nadnerb_doow wrote:

Try localhost. I personally can’t connect to my own no-ip from my computer, I have to use localhost.

Also, that’s not an error. Anything with Note: infront of it is just a warning, nothing to be concerned about.

Edit: those are out of memory errors. Paste the contents of your client run.bat here so I can see how much memory the client has been allocated.

Read full topic

item.title: My first server, be patient
item.dc:creator: @Rosiered Rosiered
item.description:
@Rosiered wrote:

stewie0888:

thats not an error thats just some idiot coding

By the way, that useless little half-asses post of yours. Wasen’t the least bit helpful.

Try and get your post count higher with usefull information.

I’ll do that really fast and add to this post when done.

EDIT #1- Right well, I got this (not sure if its an error) I think its like the last notification I recieved.

Note: .\Bulby\players\objectLoader.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Note: .\Bulby\clanchat\Room.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. Press any key to continue . . .[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 06, 2009, 01:03:37 am[/size][hr]Okay well… I ran the source and the client in order. But I’m still getting frozen at connection to update server.

I’m using the no-ip host that I made instead of localhost.

Any ideas?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 06, 2009, 01:07:45 am[/size][hr]Just now snagged this/these error(s) while trying to connect to localhost (127.0.0.1)

NineScape 508 Client! Exception in thread "Thread-6" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space at Class89.method1507(Class89.java:530) at Class87.run(Class87.java:71) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space at RSString.method1612(RSString.java:856) at Class21_Sub1.method364(Class21_Sub1.java:101) at Class60.method586(Class60.java:42) at Class21_Sub1.method368(Class21_Sub1.java:206) at Class44.method488(Class44.java:409) at client.method39(client.java:723) at client.method33(client.java:749) at Applet_Sub1.method30(Applet_Sub1.java:1125) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:157) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap spa ce at java.util.Arrays.copyOf(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Resource.getBytes(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) at client.method29(client.java:46) at Applet_Sub1.method20(Applet_Sub1.java:923) at Applet_Sub1.destroy(Applet_Sub1.java:1241) at Applet_Sub1.windowClosing(Applet_Sub1.java:1221) at java.awt.Window.processWindowEvent(Unknown Source) at java.awt.Window.processEvent(Unknown Source) at item.title: My first server, be patient
item.dc:creator: @nadnerb_doow nadnerb_doow
item.description:
@nadnerb_doow wrote:

Correct. Make sure you’re running the server source first, or you’ll get that error again, and we’ll be back at square one

Read full topic

item.title: My first server, be patient
item.dc:creator: @Rosiered Rosiered
item.description:
@Rosiered wrote:

Okay see like, no
xD

Like I said before most guides are pretty shady around helping out with that.

I see now, so like. HALP?!

I have a source folder and a client folder.

What I understand from what you’re saying right now is that
1st I need to use the ‘run’ batch file in my source folder
2nd Run the client
3rd Trouble shoot and give more feedback?

Read full topic

item.title: My first server, be patient
item.dc:creator: @nadnerb_doow nadnerb_doow
item.description:
@nadnerb_doow wrote:

Those messages you get on compiling aren’t errors, they’re warnings. You don’t need to worry about them though, the client compiled if you get them. error_game_js5connect usually appears if the client cannot find the server - are you sure you’re running the server before you try and run the client?

Read full topic

item.title: My first server, be patient
item.dc:creator: @Rosiered Rosiered
item.description:
@Rosiered wrote:

Any suggestions on a fix?

I’m damn near willing for any kind of help.

Read full topic
